org.obd.query.impl
Class OBDSQLShard

java.lang.Object
  org.obd.query.impl.AbstractShard
      org.obd.query.impl.AbstractSQLShard
          org.obd.query.impl.OBDSQLShard
All Implemented Interfaces:
AnalysisCapableRepository, AnnotationRepository, BasicRepository, MutableRepository, QueryableRepository, SearchableRepository, Shard
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChadoSQLShard, OBDSimpleSQLShard
public class OBDSQLShard
extends AbstractSQLShard
implements Shard

Implements a Shard by wrapping a relational database using the OBD-SQL Schema. Schema docs

Author:
cjm

getAnnotatedEntityCountBySubset

public java.util.Map<Node,java.lang.Integer> getAnnotatedEntityCountBySubset(AnnotationLinkQueryTerm aqt,
                                                                             java.lang.String subsetId)
                                                                      throws ShardExecutionException
Description copied from interface: Shard
Given a set of annotations and a subset/view over an ontology(s), map all annotations to the subset and then count the number of DISTINCT annotated entities related to the mapped class. The deductive closure is used here.

Formally: count(n) = |e| where e R n Here, e R n denotes that there is some relation R between e and n that can be deduced from some annotation, plus the axioms in the ontology. The value of R is by default left unbound; it can be set by passing in the appropriate annotation query object For example, if the annotations contained: genotype1 size of Eyeball genotype2 thickness of Wall of eyeball genotype2 color of Iris Then the count for "Eyeball" would be 2, because both genotypes are related to "Eyeball" via some chain of relations (specific relations can be selected using methods on the annotation query. In the example above, part_of is included) Note that if the subset contains the class "Organ", then these annotated entities would also count for this class

Specified by:
getAnnotatedEntityCountBySubset in interface Shard
Overrides:
getAnnotatedEntityCountBySubset in class AbstractShard
Parameters:
aqt - query for fetching annotations. If null will select all
subsetId - identifier for the subset/view to map to
Returns:
counts broken down by class node used to annotate
Throws:
ShardExecutionException

                                                                              QueryTerm targetQt)

getStatementsByQuery

public java.util.Collection<Statement> getStatementsByQuery(QueryTerm queryTerm)
Description copied from interface: QueryableRepository
given a query, find matching statements from shard

Example: LinkQueryTerm partOfNucleusQuery = new LinkQueryTerm(partOf, new LabelQueryTerm(AliasType.ANY_LABEL, "nucleus")); stmts = shard.getStatementsByQuery(new AnnotationLinkQueryTerm(partOfNucleusQuery));

Specified by:
getStatementsByQuery in interface QueryableRepository
Returns:
non-null Collection of any kind of Statement
See Also:
QueryTest

Description copied from interface: Shard

translateQuery

public java.lang.String translateQuery(QueryTerm qt,
                                       org.bbop.rdbms.RelationalQuery rq,
                                       java.lang.String subjCol)
Specified by:
translateQuery in class AbstractSQLShard
Parameters:
qt - - OBD Query to be translated
rq - - constructed Relation SQL Query
subjCol - - column to use in where constraint. Can be null
Returns:
tableName Recursively translates a query or part of a query to SQL. Examples: Link(parent) => link(X,R,Y) where Y=parent Link(rel,parent) => link(X,R,Y) where Y=parent, R=rel Link(Link(gparent)) => link(X,R1,Z),link(Z,R2,Y) where Y=gparent Link(node=child) => link(X,R,Y) where X=child Link(Label(ID,Equals(parent))) => link(X,R,Y) where Y=parent Link(Label(LABEL,Equals(pl))) => link(X,R,Y),label(Y,L) where L=pl Link(Label(SYNONYM,StartsWith(match))) => link(X,R,Y),synonym(Y,L) where L like match% As this method recurses into the QueryTerm tree, a forward record is kept of what column should be used in the match/join (subjCol). For example, in Link(Link(gp)) we start off with the outer Link, generate a FROM clause involving the link table: link(X,R1,Y) X is used in the SELECT. When we traverse to the inner link, passing Y as the value for subjCol. we generate a new link in the FROM clause link(A,R2,B) And then use the subjCol to join on Y(subjCol)=A We can simplify the relational notation by unifying variable and writing: link(X,R1,Y),link(Y,R2,B) The same principle applies to other QueryTerm clauses; eg Link(Label(StartsWith(LABEL,label)))

getAnnotatedNodeCount

public int getAnnotatedNodeCount()
Description copied from interface: Shard
fetches total number of annotated entities in shard. An annotated entity is any entity that is represented by a node that is the target of an annotation statement

mergeIdentifierByIDSpaces

public void mergeIdentifierByIDSpaces(java.lang.String fromIdSpace,
                                      java.lang.String toIdSpace)
                               throws ShardExecutionException
Description copied from interface: MutableRepository
Merges links to two identifiers. It is common that there may be two IDs for the same entity, typically across ID spaces. This method merges links from one of those ID spaces into the other.

Specified by:
